title: Pecker and Howard Remove Trump Documents from National Enquirer Safe Before Inauguration
summary: David Pecker and Dylan Howard remove remaining Trump documents from National Enquirer safe weeks before inauguration, fearing liability, either destroying or relocating files. This action was part of a broader pattern of document management and potential evidence suppression related to Trump's presidential campaign and personal history.

sources.title: National Enquirer removed Trump secrets before inauguration
Enquirer's safe held damaging Trump stories
Former National Enquirer publisher testifies about his role in helping Trump in 2016

notes: Second wave of document handling after November shredding. Files found missing from master list later. Fear of legal exposure with Trump becoming president. Trump thanked Pecker for handling situations at Trump Tower meeting. NPR reporting highlights ongoing pattern of document management and potential suppression of damaging stories.
